description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Sutton

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Sutton to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}
The LIP is produced by the London Borough of Sutton and agreed with us. It sets out the details on transport infrastructure changes in a three-year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/sutton-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 221KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-sutton.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 74KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-sutton.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 69KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/sutton-lip-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 67KB","image":{}},{"title":"Public Transport Access Levels - Sutton","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/public-transport-access-levels-sutton.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 2.34MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Find out more about LIP funding.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Sutton"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in the borough was 93,815 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2021 is 90,400.
Residents in Sutton made an average of 453,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 54%","Tube/DLR: 4%","National Rail and London Overground: 7%","Bus/Tram: 9%","Taxi/Other: 1%","Cycle: 1%","Walking: 24%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 5,692 daily cycle trips on average starting in Sutton between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding for your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 61 individuals killed or seriously injured in Sutton. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 43.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Sutton"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Sutton\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Sutton\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eSutton Link\u003c/strong\u003e - we're looking at options for a new, direct and quicker transport link between Sutton and Merton","\u003cstrong\u003eA217 junction with Lumley Road\u003c/strong\u003e - we're carrying out a review of collisions at this junction and exploring potential safety improvements","\u003cstrong\u003eCarshalton High Street\u003c/strong\u003e - we're reviewing HGV movements and pedestrian crossings along this section of the A232"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Sutton"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Two tram stops","Around 365 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Sutton\"\u003esee all 25 day bus routes in Sutton\u003c/a\u003e ","One coach stop","Cycle Superhighway 7 which runs from Merton to the City of London","Around 155 traffic signals","Over 18 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Sutton:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these are maintained by \u003ca href=\"https://www.sutton.gov.uk/\"\u003eSutton\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches","Three bus garages in Sutton that are \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by bus companies\u003c/a\u003e "," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.sutton.gov.uk/info/200195/parking\"\u003ereported to Sutton\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
